frontmatter.title: CivicActions Expands Government Open Data Services with DKAN Project
frontmatter.link_text: CivicActions Assumes Leadership of DKAN Project, Expands Government Open Data Services

node.html: We look forward to bringing fresh enthusiasm and awareness to the impact of open data for governments and citizens as we take leadership of the open source open data platform DKAN.

frontmatter.title: California Agile Child Welfare Project Hires CivicActions for DevOps
frontmatter.link_text: California’s Agile Child Welfare Project Awards Bid to CivicActions

node.html: California’s Child Welfare Digital Service (CWDS) project has awarded an early contract for development operations to CivicActions. We’re thrilled to be part of this high profile effort to bring agile, user centered services to the state.

frontmatter.title: CivicActions in GCN: ‘How to be smart about open source’
frontmatter.link_text: GCN: How to Be Smart About Open Source

node.html: GCN interviewed CivicActions’ Henry Poole and Marc Jones about how government can get the most out of open source software — by choosing the right technology for the project and creating code as a public asset.

frontmatter.title: CivicActions’ Elizabeth Raley in StateScoop: ‘Free Online Agile Development Course Targets Government Executives’
frontmatter.link_text: StateScoop: Free Online Agile Development Course Targets Government Executives

node.html: CivicActions’ Director of Professional Services Elizabeth Raley was interviewed about her work with Agile Government Leadership to launch an online training tailored for government executives who want to bring agile practices to their agencies.

frontmatter.title: CivicActions Named to 2017 GovTech100 Top Companies List

node.html: We’re honored to be ranked among Government Technology’s top 100 companies recognized for transforming government through innovative technologies that will improve services for citizens.
